<span style="color:red"> Exercise:<br> Make a histogram for the variable  FREE LUNCH, and make sure it has all the right elements, and get rid of unnecessary elements.
</span>

```{r}

```{r GGplotFree.Lunch, eval=FALSE}

base= ggplot(eduwa1,aes(x = Free.Lunch))  
histogram1= base + geom_histogram(breaks=seq(0, 1780, 20), 
                          boundary=0, 
                          col="red", 
                          fill="blue", 
                          alpha=.3, 
                          na.rm = TRUE, 
                          inherit.aes = TRUE)
histogram1= histogram1 + stat_bin(binwidth = 20, aes(label=..count..), cex=1.8, 
                  geom = "text", boundary = 0,vjust=-0.5)
historam1= histogram1 + labs(title="WA Schools Providing Free Lunch", subtitle =sourceText, x="Quantity of Free Lunches", y="Number of Schools") + 
  xlim(c(0,1000))+
  ylim(c(0,360))
histogram1
```

```{r}
histogram2 = histogram1 + scale_x_continuous("Quantity of Free Lunches", breaks=seq(0, 1000, 100), limits = c(0,1000))
histogram2
```
